TopicTitle: Paper Space Program 1.8 (KSP Rocket Parts papercraft)

Articles.Content: Nicely done! May I suggest the soon-to-be-stock Spaceplanes plus mod? It's got some parts that would unfold quite well, like the shock cone air intake, etc.

Nicely done! May I suggest the soon-to-be-stock Spaceplanes plus mod? It's got some parts that would unfold quite well, like the shock cone air intake, etc.

I'll do what i can

Printed out all the parts for the Aeris A4 but with round intakes and without rcs thrusters. It's the same scale as the sensor array and looks quite complicated.

What have I got myself into... Well if i succeed this will be epic.

P.S.

How awesome would a model of the kerbal space center be? Just a thought.

Oh wow , looking really complicated I tnink unfolding the KSC will be really hard BTW , i've started making the Space Plane + parts
Oh , it looks like the engines are too small It may happen because images are not the same size
It's sooo hard with copy paper ! ;( I think I'll need some rigid paper...

BTW , i've started making the Space Plane + parts

Aw Yis!

Oh , it looks like the engines are too small It may happen because images are not the same size

Wait wait wait, what? You're telling me that not all of the images are the same size? Couldn't you have like, mentioned that earlier? I didnt even notice... It should be easy to rescale the round parts and reprint them, but what about the other stuff? How the hell can I know if the radial intakes (for example) are the right size?

EDIT: After measuring stuff by comparing it in-game to fuel tanks and printed out it seems that both of the wings are alright, the landing gear is okay, the standard control surfaces are a bit larger but still managable, the radial intakes and LV-45s are a bit smaller but not that noticble. Then the jet engines, jet fuel tank, cockpit and intakes are way too small, the radial docking port, sas and rcs are too big. I'll have to adjust that and re-print them. Gah.

Edited August 24, 2014 by MoffKalast

Could we get a scale for these? say on each image add a ruler for scale? I was going to print tonight, but have been scared off by that. Otherwise, is there another way round it? I'm going to warm up with an IRL papercraft first.

Could we get a scale for these? say on each image add a ruler for scale? I was going to print tonight, but have been scared off by that. Otherwise, is there another way round it? I'm going to warm up with an IRL papercraft first.

For instance , the medium-sized (on KSP wiki they're called large) Fuel tanks are about 7 cm in diameter All the images are in an A4 format

It is done! The stock Aeris 4A (with round intakes). It measures about 23 cm in length and 17 in width. Made from 200g paper using the UHU universal twist and glue.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Sorry about the poor image quality, I took them with my crappy phone and later edited them so you can actually see something I figured out the radial intakes, they needed some modifying and I think the wheels are a bit weak but I don't think I'm gonna bother making them better.

P.S.

I've got an idea: why don't you collect all the images of ksp paper crafts and put them into the first post as an imgur album (and some higher resolution pics of your original builds too)? That way people would instantly know what can be done / has been done / how it looks and wouldn't need to scroll through all the pages.

Edited August 26, 2014 by MoffKalast
